newsitem.title: USA: Computer companies to announce data standard - NYT.
newsitem.headline: Computer companies to announce data standard - NYT.

text.p: A coalition of computer makers and software developers led by Netscape Communications Corp and Progressive Networks Inc plans to announce a new audio and video data standard on Monday, the New York Times reported in its Monday's edition.
The newspaper said that the single standard, called Real Time Streaming Protocol, would enable companies using the Internet to compete more directly with radio and television broadcasters.
The coalition includes IBM Corp, Apple Computer Inc, Sun Microsystems Inc, Digital Equipment Corp and Silicon Graphics Inc, it said.
Microsoft did not belong to the coalition, it added.
The newspaper said the standard would let Internet publishers send to personal computer users digital information that could eventually become sound and video, such as three-dimensional simulations.
